The Related Discourses

35. Views (cf. SN 23: Rādha Saṃyutta)

The Mindfulness of Breathing group consists of 39 full sutras and 54 abbreviated variants for a total of 93. The material is found in fascicles 6 and 7 of Taisho No. 99. Below is a list of the English translations currently available.

Note: Previous English translations currently available at SuttaCentral are referenced below. The reader should be aware that titles for SA sutras are supplied by the translator(s). The sutra numbering follows Yinshun’s reconstruction. The Taisho sutra numbers are noted for reference ("[T 99.xxx]").

  • 1. Six Abodes of Views (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.133]
  • 2. First Discourse on Abandoning Doubt (Anālayo) [T 99.134]
  • 3. Second Discourse on Abandoning Doubt (Anālayo) [T 99.135]
  • 4. Discourse on What Matter is the Cause (Anālayo) [T 99.136]
  • 5. Third Discourse on Abandoning Doubt (Anālayo) [T 99.137]
  • 6. Fourth Discourse on Abandoning Doubt (Anālayo) [T 99.138]
  • 7. The Cause of Attachment and Sorrow (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.139]
  • 8. Second Discourse on Worry, Sorrow, Vexation, and Pain (Anālayo) [T 99.140]
  • 9. Third Discourse on Worry, Sorrow, Vexation, and Pain (Anālayo) [T 99.141]
  • 10. First Discourse on the View of a Self and What Belongs to the Self (Anālayo) [T 99.142]
  • 11. Second and Third Discourses on the View of a Self and What Belongs to the Self (Anālayo) [T 99.143]
  • 12. Second and Third Discourses on the View of a Self and What Belongs to the Self (Anālayo) [T 99.144]
  • 13. Discourse on the Influxes and the Obstruction of Confusion (Anālayo) [T 99.145]
  • 16. Discourse on the Three Feelings (Anālayo) [T 99.146]
  • 19. Discourse on the Three Types of Dukkha (Anālayo) [T 99.147]
  • 22. Discourse on the Eight Worldly Conditions (Anālayo) [T 99.148]
  • 25. First Discourse on Feeling Superior (Anālayo) [T 99.149]
  • 28. Second Discourse on Feeling Superior (Anālayo) [T 99.150]
  • 31. Third Discourse on Feeling Superior (Anālayo) [T 99.151]
  • 34. Discourse on the View of the Existence of a Self (Anālayo) [T 99.152]
  • 37. Discourse on No Difference (Anālayo) [T 99.153]
  • 40. Wrong View Regarding Actions (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.154]
  • 43. Wrong View Regarding Personal Ability (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.155]
  • 46. Wrong View Regarding the Afterlife (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.156]
  • 49. Wrong View Regarding Affliction (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.157]
  • 52. Wrong View Regarding Purity (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.158]
  • 55. Wrong View Regarding the Lack of Knowing and Seeing (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.159]
  • 58. Wrong View Regarding Knowing and Seeing (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.160]
  • 61. Wrong View Regarding Actions (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.161]
  • 64. Wrong View Regarding Actions (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.162]
  • 67. Wrong View Regarding Rebirth (Patton | Anālayo) [T 99.163]
  • 70. Discourse on the View that Winds do not Blow (Anālayo) [T 99.164]
  • 73. Discourse on the View about Great Brahmā (Anālayo) [T 99.165]
  • 76. First Discourse on the View that the Self Consists of Form (Anālayo) [T 99.166]
  • 79. Second Discourse on the View about the Self Consisting of Form (Anālayo) [T 99.167]
  • 82. Discourse on the View that the World is Eternal (Anālayo) [T 99.168]
  • 85. Discourse on the View that the Self and the World are Eternal (Anālayo) [T 99.169]
  • 88. Discourse on Views about Nirvāṇa Here and Now (Anālayo) [T 99.170]
  • 91. Discourse on Views about Annihilation (Anālayo) [T 99.171]
